alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 5:54PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Brief landspouts possible across portions of northeastern Douglas, southwestern Weld, western Arapahoe, central Denver and western Adams Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 552 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a boundary capable of producing brief landspout tornadoes along a line extending from 3 miles east of Firestone to near Lone Tree, or along a line extending from 21 miles south of Greeley to 14 miles south of Denver. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Denver, Aurora, northeastern Thornton, Centennial, eastern Highlands Ranch, Commerce City, Parker, Brighton, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Firestone, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Fort Lupton, Lochbuie, Hudson, Arapahoe Park, Buckley AFB, Barr Lake and Todd Creek. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
